intro: Elatostema beshengii, commonly known as the Beshengii prostrate elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a low-growing, herbaceous plant characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. Native to China, it thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
